moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 Nf6 4. d4
comment:
A continuation which is believed less
strong that the theoretical 4.O-O but, however, must be treated with respect.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 Nf6 4. d4 exd4 5. e5 Ne4 6. Nxd4 Be7
comment: A developing move but...not very aggressive

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 Nf6 4. d4 exd4 5. e5 Ne4 6. Nxd4 Be7 7. O-O Nxd4 8. Qxd4 Nc5 9. f4 b6 10. f5
comment:
(!) Bird is
not afraid of Steinitz threat to replace the Knight in c5 with the Bishop, and
with the intention to exploit the position of his opponent's King, he
continues with his attacking plan.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 Nf6 4. d4 exd4 5. e5 Ne4 6. Nxd4 Be7 7. O-O Nxd4 8. Qxd4 Nc5 9. f4 b6 10. f5 Nb3 11. Qe4
comment: "Do you want a Rook? Just take it!"

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 Nf6 4. d4 exd4 5. e5 Ne4 6. Nxd4 Be7 7. O-O Nxd4 8. Qxd4 Nc5 9. f4 b6 10. f5 Nb3 11. Qe4 Nxa1
comment:
"Did you take it? Good. Do
you think that now I want to take your Rook in a8? You are wrong!"

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 Nf6 4. d4 exd4 5. e5 Ne4 6. Nxd4 Be7 7. O-O Nxd4 8. Qxd4 Nc5 9. f4 b6 10. f5 Nb3 11. Qe4 Nxa1 12. f6
1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 Nf6 4. d4 exd4 5. e5 Ne4 6. Nxd4 Be7 7. O-O Nxd4 8. Qxd4 Nc5 9. f4 b6 10. f5 Nb3 11. Qe4 Nxa1 12. f6 Bc5+ 13. Kh1 Rb8
comment:
It seems that Steinitz want to keep all the
advantages he has apparently obtained.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 Nf6 4. d4 exd4 5. e5 Ne4 6. Nxd4 Be7 7. O-O Nxd4 8. Qxd4 Nc5 9. f4 b6 10. f5 Nb3 11. Qe4 Nxa1 12. f6 Bc5+ 13. Kh1 Rb8 14. e6
comment: It looks like a mistake, and probably it is. Maybe is it a "terroristic" move?

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 Nf6 4. d4 exd4 5. e5 Ne4 6. Nxd4 Be7 7. O-O Nxd4 8. Qxd4 Nc5 9. f4 b6 10. f5 Nb3 11. Qe4 Nxa1 12. f6 Bc5+ 13. Kh1 Rb8 14. e6 Rg8
comment: (??) the move that such a terrorist as was Bird reached its purpose.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 Nf6 4. d4 exd4 5. e5 Ne4 6. Nxd4 Be7 7. O-O Nxd4 8. Qxd4 Nc5 9. f4 b6 10. f5 Nb3 11. Qe4 Nxa1 12. f6 Bc5+ 13. Kh1 Rb8 14. e6 Rg8 15. Qxh7
comment:
+- (?) What a pity!
Taken by euphoria of a close victory Bird does not see a beautiful mate in
three.
